Flub.Name: Growth Areas
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Type
Flub.Description: The shape of the generic trees to grow.

Flub.Name: Conifers
Flub.Description: Sharp, tall spikes that look like coniferous trees.

Flub.Name: Broadleaf
Flub.Description: A highly generic shape that looks like a wide coverage of broadleaf plants like forests and jungles.

Flub.Name: Shrubs
Flub.Description: A simple, sparse growth that looks like shrubs

Flub.Name: Health
Flub.Description: The overall health of the ecosystem. Degrading health will create sparser populations, tree stump-like formations, and general dead patches. When Health goes below 0%, growths will be forced into small groves or sparse populations in only a few random places on the terrain.

Flub.Name: Height
Flub.Description: The arbitrary height of the individual plants.

Flub.Name: Style
Flub.Description: The style of the generated tree shape.

Flub.Name: Seed
Flub.Description: The randomization pattern or seed for the node's process.

Flub.Name: Inhibitors
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Growth
Flub.Description: The fertility of the ecosystem.

Flub.Name: Flowing Water
Flub.Description: Growth bias towards freshwater flows.

Flub.Name: Avoid
Flub.Description: Trees will grow away from flowing water or snow accumulation. Useful for places with rivers, snow accumulation, etc.

Flub.Name: Seek
Flub.Description: Trees will grow closer to where water flows, often in shadowed places. Useful for arid environments, canyons, etc.

Flub.Name: Flows
Flub.Description: The amount of flow to simulate.

Flub.Name: Consolidate Flows
Flub.Description: Consolidation of smaller flows. Higher values merge smaller flows into larger ones.

Flub.Name: Simulation Bias
Flub.Description: Artificially bias the growth to lower or higher areas. Useful for artistic tweaking.

Flub.Name: Altitude Min/Max
Flub.Description: The altitude range within which plants can grow.

Flub.Name: Slope Min/Max
Flub.Description: The slope range within which plants can grow.

Flub.Name: Patches
Flub.Description: The amount of empty patches in the vegetation growth areas.

Flub.Name: Chaos
Flub.Description: The distortion of the vegetation grove/clump edges.

Flub.Name: Smooth
Flub.Description: The amount of edge smoothing where vegetation becomes sparse.
